required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Retrospective Cohort Study: Influence of MTHFR C677T and A1298C Polymorphisms on the Survival of Pediatric Patients With Non-Hodgkin's Lymphoma
clinical_study.official_title: A Retrospective Cohort Study: Influence of MTHFR C677T and A1298C Polymorphisms on the Survival of Pediatric Patients With Non-Hodgkin's Lymphoma

brief_summary.textblock: The primary purpose of this retrospective study was to investigate the influence of methylenetetrahydrofolate reductase (MTHFR) C677T/A1298C polymorphism on the survival of pediatric patients with Non-Hodgkin lymphoma (NHL) treated with modified NHL-BFM95 protocol in south China.

primary_outcome.description: Overall survival time was calculated from the time of initial diagnosis to death

primary_outcome.measure: Events including progression, relapse, and secondary cancer
primary_outcome.description: Event-free survival (EFS) time was calculated from the time of initial diagnosis to first event.

study_pop.textblock: We reviewed all the medical records of the patients who met the inclusion criteria in Sun Yat-sen University Cancer Center

clinical_study.keyword: MTHFR C677T polymorphism；A1298C; Pediatric Non-Hodgkin Lymphoma；Survival.
